name: Proximal
dostring:
Demonstrate liver, celiac vessels, and spine.
Celiac vessels =  seagull sign.
Measure the AP diameter.
Measure from outer wall to outer wall.
optimize: Disperse bowel gas with gentle pressure.

name: Mid
dostring:
Show liver, celiac vessels, and spine.
Measure the AP diameter.
Measure from outer wall to outer wall
optimize: Disperse bowel gas with gentle pressure.

name: Distal
dostring:
Demonstrate spine only.
Measure the AP diameter.
Measure from outer wall to outer wall.
optimize: Disperse bowel gas with gentle pressure.

name: Bifurcation
dostring:
Measure the AP diameter.
Measure from outer wall to outer wall.

name: Sagittal
dostring: Demonstrate the aorta from the proximal to the distal end.

name: Sagittal Measurement
dostring:
Demonstrate the aorta in the proximal sagittal frame.
Measure 2cm distal to the SMA, perpendicular to flow.
Measure outer wall to outer wall.

name: Parasternal Long
dostring:
Demonstrate descending thoracic aorta.
Display marker must be on the left side of the screen.
Probe marker must be directed towards the hip.
measure:
Ejection fraction:
- Normal: 55-65%
- Mildly depressed
- Moderately depressed
- Severely depressed
- Hyperdynamic

name: Parasternal Short
dostring:
Demonstrate 3 levels: papillary muscles, mitral valve, and aortic valve.
Need not be in the same single loop.
optimize: Rotate the probe on the best long axis.

name: Apical Four Chamber
dostring: Interventricular septum should be vertical.
optimize: Drag and drop the probe from the PSSAX.
measure: Normal right ventricle is 0.6 of left ventricle.

name: Subxiphoid
dostring: Demonstrate the liver.
optimize: Scan through the liver.

name: Common Femoral Vein
dostring:
Demonstrate the saphenofemoral junction.
Demonstrate complete apposition of the vessel walls.

name: Superficial Femoral Vein
dostring:
Compress every 1-2 cm along medial thigh, until the adductor canal.
Demonstrate complete apposition of the vessel walls.

name: Popliteal Vein
dostring:
Demonstrate the popliteal vein and the trifurcation.
Demonstrate complete apposition of the vessel walls.

name: RUQ
dostring:
Demonstrate lung - diaphragm - spine- liver - Morison's pouch - caudal tip of the liver - inferior renal pole.
Perform a smooth slide.

name: LUQ
dostring:
Demonstrate lung - diaphragm - spleen - caudal tip of the spleen - inferior renal pole.
Perform a smooth slide.

name: Suprapubic Sag.
dostring: Fan edge to edge.

name: Suprapubic Trans.
dostring: Fan edge to edge.

name: Subxiphoid
dostring: Fan edge to edge.

name: Right Lung
dostring: Show 3 intercostal spaces

name: Left Lung
dostring: Show 2 intercostal spaces

name: Sagittal
dostring:
Depict portal vein.
Focus on gallbladder neck.

name: Anterior Wall
dostring: Measure the anterior wall of the gallbladder.
optimize: Use zoom.

name: Common Bile Duct
dostring:
Measure the CBD (a) above the sagittal portal vein as it enters the porta hepatis, or (b) Mickey mouse ear, or (c) channel above the transverse portal vein.
Measure inner wall to inner wall.
optimize: Use color and zoom.

name: Heart
dostring:
Demonstrate 2 views.
Preferably parasternal long axis and apical four chamber view.
measure:
Ejection fraction:
- Normal: 55-65%
- Mildly depressed
- Moderately depressed
- Severely depressed
- Hyperdynamic

name: IVC
dostring:
Assess volume status and volume tolerance.
Perform measurements 2 cm from the diaphragm and 1 cm from the hepatic vein.
measure:
Diameter 1.5 - 2.5 = normal.
Collapsibility Index > 50% = fluid responsive.

name: Morrison's Pouch
dostring: Demonstrate 1 view.

name: Aorta
dostring: Demonstrate any 2 views.

name: Pulmonary
dostring: Demonstrate 2 views.
optimize:
Reduce depth to 5 cm to assess pleural line.
Increase depth to 12-15 cm to assess B-lines.

name: IVC Diameter
dostring:
Assess volume status.
Perform measurements 2 cm from the diaphragm and 1 cm from the hepatic vein.Measure perpandicular to flow.
Measure inner wall to inner wall.
optimize: The walls should be as echogenic as possible.
measure:
Diameter 1.5 - 2.5 = normal.
Collapsibility Index > 50% = fluid responsive.

name: IVC Collapsibility
dostring:
Perform in M-mode.
Assess volume tolerance.
Perform measurements 2 cm from the diaphragm and 1 cm from the hepatic vein.Measure IVC diameter with inspiration and expiration.
measure:
Collapsability index (CI) = IVC max - IVC min / IVC max
Check:
CI < 50% = Volume responsive.

name: Sagittal Uterus
dostring:
Fan through the entire uterus.
Look for multiple gestations.
Confirm IUP with yolk sac+.
optimize: Gestational sac/Double Decidual sign is insufficient to confirm IUP.

name: Transverse Uterus
dostring:
Fan through the entire uterus.
Look for multiple gestations.
Confirm IUP with yolk sac+.
optimize: Gestational sac/Double Decidual sign is insufficient to confirm IUP.

name: Crown Rump Length
dostring: Measure from crown to rump.
optimize: Use Zoom.

name: EMM
dostring: Measure from gestational sac to outer edge of the myometrium.
optimize: Use Zoom.

name: Fetal Heart Rate
dostring:
Use M-mode.
Select two peaks 1 or 2 beats apart (machine dependent).
optimize:
Avoid pulse wave doppler
Use zoom.

name: Right Adnexa
dostring: Demonstrate 2-views: sagittal and transverse.

name: Left Adnexa
dostring: Demonstrate 2-views: sagittal and transverse.

name: Sagittal
dostring:
Fan through the entire uterus.
Look for multiple gestations.

name: Transverse Uterus
dostring:
Fan through the entire uterus.
Look for multiple gestations.

name: Biparietal Diameter
dostring: Measure from outer edge to inner edge, perpandicular to the falx cerebri.

name: Head Circumference
dostring: Place ruler markers at either end of the falx cerebri.

name: Femur Length
dostring: Measure from end to end of femur.

name: Fetal Heart Rate
dostring:
Use M-mode.
Select two peaks 1 or 2 beats apart (machine dependent).
optimize:
Avoid pulse wave doppler
Use zoom.

name: Transverse Ocular
dostring: Demonstrate posterior chamber by fanning from one end to another.
optimize: Increase gain to better visualize hemorrhage and detachment.

name: Transverse ONSD
dostring:
Measure 3mm behind retina.
Measure perpendicular to axis of optic nerve.
optimize:
Average the value obtained with the sagittal ONSD.
Normal ONSD: <5mm.
Gray zone = 5-6mm.
Increased ICP: >6mm.
measure:
Normal < 5 mm.
 Grey zone = 5 - 6 mm.
Abnormal >6 mm.

name: Sagittal Ocular
dostring: Demonstrate posterior chamber by fanning from one end to another.
optimize: Increase gain to better visualize hemorrhage and detachment.

name: Sagittal ONSD
dostring:
Measure 3mm behind retina.
Measure perpendicular to axis of optic nerve.
measure:
Average the value obtained with the sagittal ONSD.
Normal ONSD: <5mm.
Gray zone = 5-6mm.
Increased ICP: >6mm.

name: Sagittal
optimize: Ask the patient to take a deep breath to push the kidney below the ribs.

name: Measurement
dostring: Measure the kidney in two planes.

name: Transverse
dostring:
Fan edge to edge.
Optimize width.

name: Measurement
dostring: Measure the kidney in two planes.

name: Sagittal Bladder
dostring: Measure in 2 planes (cross).

name: Transverse Bladder
dostring: Measure 1 plane (minus).

name: Sagittal Normal
dostring: Demonstrate normal area with the "mow the lawn" technique.

name: Transverse Normal
dostring: Demonstrate normal area with the "mow the lawn" technique.

name: Abnormal Trans.
dostring: Demonstrate abnormal area with the "mow the lawn" technique.

name: Abnormal Sag.
dostring: Demonstrate abnormal area with the "mow the lawn" technique.

name: Fluid Collection
dostring:
Measure the size of the fluid collection in 2 planes.
Measure the depth.

name: Anterior R+L
dostring: Start at the midclavicular line, and slide inferiorly.
measure:
Assess for pneumothorax = 3-4cm
Else:
Minimum depth = 15cm.
Acute interstitial syndrome = at least 3 B-lines in 2 rib spaces on both sides of the chest.

name: Lateral R+L
dostring: Start at the anterior axillary line, and slide inferiorly.
measure:
Assess for pneumothorax = 3-4cm
Else:
Minimum depth = 15cm.
Minimum depth of 15cm to assess for B lines.
Acute interstitial syndrome = at least 3 B-lines in 2 rib spaces on both sides of the chest.

name: Posterior R+L
dostring:
Perform on posterior thorax.
May be combined with the diaphragm view.
measure:
Assess for pneumothorax = 3-4cm
Acute interstitial syndrome = at least 3 B-lines in 2 rib spaces on both sides of the chest.

name: Diaphragm R+L
dostring: Demonstrate lung, diaphragm and spine.
optimize: Ask the patient to take a deep breath.
measure: Pleural effusion = positive spine sign, loss of mirror image, and positive curtain sign.
